speaker: Ignatius
text: Phew! I've been marching along for what seems forever and a day. But it's not much farther until I reach Nohr. I hope Father is glad to see me. But the closer I get, the more enemies I see. Is trouble everywhere here? I hope I'm able to reach him. I'll be fine. I'll be fine. Just need to keep telling myself that. I'm not a child anymore.

speaker: Child
text: Help! Help me! Please!

speaker: Ignatius
text: What's wrong? You look as if devils have been at your back!

speaker: Old Woman
text: Oh, worse! Far worse! Devils we could fight! Our village is about to be invaded by enemies that go unseen!

speaker: Ignatius
text: Invisible enemies? Oh, no! What will you do? I mean, what can I do? I am Ignatius, son of Benny, one of Nohr's most formidable knights. You can have...confidence in me.  All right, you two run past. I'll stand my ground here and fight them off. I swear that I won't let them inside. But summon more help, if you can.

speaker: Old Woman
text: What?! But they'll be here soon. By the time we find help, you'll be dead!

speaker: Ignatius
text: No. I'll be right here, fighting. But go NOW.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Yes, yes. Of course.

speaker: Ignatius
text: Stay calm. Stay CALM. Deep breath. Now another. I'll be fine. I'll be FINE. I've got my silly little charm, after all. That's always kept me safe. Best present Father ever gave me.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Oh! You! Burly fellow! We need your help! Our village is about to be attacked! Some brave soul is standing guard alone to fight them off. He may be a knight, and he's got the courage of 10 men. But he'll be a goner! And then...our village will be wide open to those fiends.

speaker: Benny
text: What's that? Who was he?

speaker: Child
text: We don't know. He said his name was Ignatius. I think he was scared. But he didn't want to show it.

speaker: Benny
text: Ignatius, you say?!

speaker: Child
text: Yes. Said he was son of someone... Flenny? Denny? Penny? Some knight of Nohr.

speaker: Benny
text: No doubt. It's him. What's he doing putting himself at risk? He should have run too! I'm coming, Son. Oh, yes, and with the vengeance of ten thousand men!

speaker: Benny
text: Have no fear! Dad is here!

speaker: Ignatius
text: Don't come any closer! I swear, I'll cut you where you stand, you big oaf! You are NOT getting inside this village!

speaker: Benny
text: Um, whoa. It's me, Son. You know, me, Dad.

speaker: Ignatius
text: Father! Sorry, I... I didn't know you were here fighting too.

speaker: Benny
text: Ah, of course, Son. Came running as soon as I heard you were in trouble. I'm going to make all their heads roll—far, far away. Where they can't hurt you. Please now. Step back. Dad's going to fix all this.

speaker: Ignatius
text: I won't, Father. I can't.

speaker: Benny
text: Hmm? Can't?

speaker: Ignatius
text: I...I can help. I must. It's time that I do my part. I can't be scared. You've protected me for so long. Now I must do the protecting.

speaker: Benny
text: Has my little boy grown up? Already? Ignatius, are you sure you want to join your dad on the field of battle?

speaker: Ignatius
text: Yes. It would be my honor. Let us defend this village...together.

speaker: Benny
text: You impress me, Son. You've developed great strength.

speaker: Ignatius
text: What do you mean by that? I'm...not strong. I would have died had you not come to my rescue, Father. I'm a damned shame, standing beside someone as formidable as you.

speaker: Benny
text: Ignatius, no!

speaker: Ignatius
text: Father, as long as I'm at it, I need to speak my piece.

speaker: Benny
text: Hmm? Please, Son. There's no need.

speaker: Ignatius
text: Yes, there is. You've got to let me join your forces. I will never be the man you are unless I get the right kind of training. Or else I'll never be anything but a lily-livered fool.

speaker: Benny
text: But, Son, you're still so—

speaker: Ignatius
text: I'll help you, Father! I swear I can. You've kept me so well protected in the Deeprealms. But I must learn to give protection. I can't hide behind my father forever!

speaker: Benny
text: ... Ah, all right. I'll agree, Ignatius. But only to show you what your dad's life as a knight is really like. I am not half as brave as you think. I just have a taste for war.

speaker: Ignatius
text: Thank you, Father. I won't let you down. One day, I will be a great hero like you. I'll work hard. I'll pay attention. I want to be just like you, Father.

speaker: Benny
text: Is that so? No need for that, Son. I'm proud of you just as you are.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Unbelievable...

speaker: Takumi
text: Brother, what's wrong?

speaker: Ryoma
text: It can't be, yet I've gotten word that my son is missing from the Deeprealms.

speaker: Takumi
text: What?! Shiro's missing?

speaker: Ryoma
text: He's left of his own accord, but he's never been here before. I haven't prepared Shiro for what he must know about our world.

speaker: Takumi
text: We need to find him! I'll alert the others at once.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Thank you. Shiro has no idea what sort of danger he's in here.

speaker: Shiro
text: Hmm... So THIS is the world that has been kept a secret from me? Pretty dull, if you ask me. Maybe if I can find this Hoshido palace then it'll all make sense. From what I overheard back home, my dad is a bigger deal here than I thought. What's he called again? Big Cheese of Hoshido? Which would make me... I dunno. Little Cheese? I must be some kind of royalty though. I always knew Dad was a major deal. But, royalty?! I still can't believe it.

speaker: Tarba
text: Wait up, fancy britches. What brings you all the way out here?

speaker: Shiro
text: What? None of your business.

speaker: Tarba
text: You're not welcome here. Now I'll forget that I ever saw you. Long as you hand over your weapons and armor, that is. Refuse, and you won't walk outta here alive.

speaker: Shiro
text: You ready for this? I doubt it. Fine then. Take your best shot.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Over there, that's...that's Shiro!

speaker: Takumi
text: Come on! He's surrounded—there's no way he can fight them all off!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Shiro, you shouldn't be here.

speaker: Shiro
text: Dad! Or should I say...Big Cheese of Hoshido?

speaker: Ryoma
text: We can discuss that another time. Leave here now. I'll take care of this.

speaker: Shiro
text: Ha, really? When the party's just getting started? Hey, also, you big liar, where are all the monsters you said were here? These guys are just...well, guys. Hardly a match for me.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Don't be a fool, Shiro. I haven't prepared you for a place in my world. That includes knowing how to handle yourself on the battlefield!

speaker: Tarba
text: Hand over whatcha got, and I swear that you'll walk outta here alive. Bah! Who am I kidding? I'm gonna sell all you got, right down to your bones!

speaker: Ryoma
text: Shiro, you have disobeyed me for the last time. And you will show me respect—or I will show you how I deal with utter fools.

speaker: Shiro
text: How can you call me that?!

speaker: Ryoma
text: I didn't raise you to be this irresponsible.

speaker: Shiro
text: Dad, want a reality check? You didn't raise me at all.

speaker: Ryoma
text: What? I did what I had to. I have the weight of the world on my shoulders, Son. I put you somewhere that was safe from our family's enemies. What was all this anyway? Some sort of adventure? Had you been slain, don't you know that all of Hoshido would grieve you?

speaker: Shiro
text: Hoshido? Then it's true.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Tell me who told you. Your caretakers were under strict orders of secrecy.

speaker: Shiro
text: What?! No one. Everyone kept your secret. But you really are...?

speaker: Ryoma
text: That's right. I am the royal head of a kingdom known as Hoshido. A kingdom that you will rule one day. If you survive so long.

speaker: Shiro
text: How could you keep this secret from me?! Didn't you think I have a right to know?

speaker: Ryoma
text: I'm sorry. I had my reasons initially. And then later... Well, the truth is that you haven't been maturing the role.

speaker: Shiro
text: That's not right. If you'd only told me, I would have taken things more seriously. How else was I supposed to turn out, being treated like I'm special for no good reason! This battle has been the only moment of truth in my whole damned life. I don't mean your confession here. I mean seeing all this...death. I can barely stop my hands from shaking. I was trained to fight. Not to kill. You...you should have prepared me for this sort of life.

speaker: Ryoma
text: I see... Yes, I suppose I should have. But now that we're here, answer me this. From what you've seen of me today, what do you think your father's power is for?

speaker: Shiro
text: Huh, your power? To leave the field bloodied with your enemies?

speaker: Ryoma
text: No. Is that really what you saw here? What we ALL achieved here?

speaker: Shiro
text: No. I guess not. Those guys wanted to bloody the field with us.

speaker: Ryoma
text: Yes. They abused their power. You and I had to stop them. All lives are sacred. Even theirs. And so, taking their lives is a serious decision. But it had to be done, for the sake of OUR way of life. I falls to me, and one day to you, to bear that heavy responsibility.

speaker: Shiro
text: Still, you didn't prepare me for this...

speaker: Ryoma
text: Shiro, I'll prepare you now, if you're truly ready to join my side. Now that you know who I really am, you can decide to be who YOU really are.

speaker: Shiro
text: Are you sure you want me around?

speaker: Ryoma
text: Sure, if you're sure. But remember that I'm more than your father. I'll warn you—speak to anyone in our family, and they'll tell you about me. I'm as strict as they come. Some even say I'm severe. But it's all for Hoshido.

speaker: Shiro
text: I'll do my best! Er, not that I have a clue what I'm up against.

speaker: Ryoma
text: We stand together then. Now, I make you this vow, Son. No more secrets. I need to prepare you fully to fill my role...in due time.

speaker: Takumi
text: Weird. Where's my son gone to? Damn his Deeprealm for being so big. I know I can't expect Kiragi to stay in his village all the time. But I thought at least he'd be out here, hunting or fishing. Somewhere.

speaker: Sakura
text: Big Brother! Come quick! Those creepy soldiers have followed us here.

speaker: Takumi
text: Which ones? The really creepy soldiers?! Ugh. Of all the times... Kiragi might be here too!

speaker: Sakura
text: What shall we do? They're coming towards us!

speaker: Takumi
text: Come on! We go to THEM!

speaker: Kiragi
text: What a day. Those fish pretty much jumped into my bucket! And then this bear - couldn't have been an easier target! Wish I'd bagged him a little closer to town. Too big to lug outta here. Too big to roll home too. Hmm. Gotta be some way... Er, hold on. What's that? Something lumbering around the forest... HELLO? Hmm, nothing. Eh, no way that's a person anyway. Too freaky. Whatever it is, it'll make a great trophy for my wall! All right. Fly straight and true, little arrow buddy. Ready, aim... FIRE!

speaker: Kiragi
text: That was a good one! Right between the... Uh, whoa. Hang on.

speaker: Kiragi
text: Uh-oh. Oopsies. Sorry 'bout that. But you really shoulda answered back. Looks like you brought friends too. Not very chatty, are ya? And call me crazy, but I'd swear you're all surrounding me. Yeah? No biggie. I've got the bow my dad gave me. Let's call this target practice!

speaker: Sakura
text: Th-there's Kiragi! What's your son doing, taking on those soldiers by himself?!

speaker: Takumi
text: HANG ON, KIRAGI! DAD'S ON THE WAY!

speaker: Takumi
text: I've got ya, Kiragi!

speaker: Kiragi
text: Dad! I knew you'd show up!

speaker: Takumi
text: Huh? Sorry that I got here, uh, late? You must have been scared to death.

speaker: Kiragi
text: Nope. I knew you'd save me.

speaker: Takumi
text: What?

speaker: Kiragi
text: Yup! But anyway, you gotta check out this big bear that I bagged, Dad!

speaker: Takumi
text: Ah, right. Big bear. Nice. But, uh, how about we focus on getting out of this mess alive, Son?

speaker: Kiragi
text: Ready for anything, Dad!

speaker: Kiragi
text: Dad, no way! No! Way! There is NO way this is what you do every day.

speaker: Takumi
text: This is nothing! You should have seen me in my last battle, when I— Uh, hold on. Not the best dad talk. I mean to say, Son, that battle was dangerous. Even deadly.

speaker: Kiragi
text: Nice!

speaker: Takumi
text: Huh?

speaker: Kiragi
text: So fun! So! Fun! It was SO fun, seeing you all be like, you know... YAAAH! BLAMMIE! I want to be just like you, Dad!

speaker: Takumi
text: Ugh... No, Son. You have to stay safe here in your Deeprealm.

speaker: Kiragi
text: Hey, but we had a blast, didn't we? Yeah, I'm coming with you for sure!

speaker: Takumi
text: What?! No, you're not. I put you here to keep you OUT of the war.

speaker: Sakura
text: Well, you have to admit he was a chip off the old block there.

speaker: Takumi
text: Sister, that's not helping.

speaker: Kiragi
text: Wow! Two against one. Done deal, yeah, Dad? Yeah.

speaker: Takumi
text: Two against—? Oh, fine. I guess. How could I say no to a face like that?

speaker: Kiragi
text: Yay for my face! I swear I won't let you down, Dad. Oh, hey! Wait. The OTHER thing. The bear I shot. Dad! Dad! It was amazing. DAD! I got it in one shot!

speaker: Takumi
text: I bet it was, Son. And thanks to you, our camp will feast on bear stew!

speaker: Selkie
text: Wait, wait! Come back, little bird! No good. It's gone. No fair, flying and stuff. Guess I'll just have to learn to fly too. Doesn't sound too hard. I'll just find the tallest tree around here and jump. Hmm? What's that glowy doorway? Hello? Anyone home? HELLO? ANYONE? Huh, nothing. I'll just take a quick peek inside...

speaker: Selkie
text: What is this place? So many unfamiliar scents! Eeeew. What's THAT smell?

speaker: Daichi
text: What have we here—a kitsune?

speaker: Selkie
text: Oooh! Where? Oh, you mean me.

speaker: Daichi
text: Must be my lucky day. I can sell a kitsune for a fortune. Dead or alive too, so I might as well make this easy. Dead will be fine.

speaker: Selkie
text: Hey, let's play, mister. And do I smell more of your friends in the wind? I do! Let's ALL play!

speaker: Daichi
text: Everyone! We've got it surrounded! Keep our circle tight—don't let it escape!

speaker: Kaden
text: Can't wait to see my Selkie! Every time I go to her Deeprealm, my daughter is even more amazing!

speaker: Hayato
text: Is that so? And you say she's a kitsune too?

speaker: Kaden
text: Sure thing. Apple doesn't fall far from the tree either—her fur's just like mine. Now it's probably even glossier than the last time I saw her! Hey! Don't get any funny ideas about Selkie. I'm warning you. Don't lay a finger on her. Or else. Which I mean in the worst way possible.

speaker: Hayato
text: You're kidding, right? I know people sometimes hunt your kind. But you do realize that I'm a friend, don't you?

speaker: Ruffian
text: No, no, NO! Get me away from her! She's nuts!

speaker: Kaden
text: Need a hand? Oh, wait. You're probably not the sort that I should help.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Another one?!

speaker: Kaden
text: Another what—a kitsune, here in these woods? By any chance, you don't mean a kitsune girl, do you? Looks like me? Stunning fur? Twinkle in the eye?

speaker: Ruffian
text: What?! Er, yeah. More or less.

speaker: Kaden
text: Ah! I smell Selkie—and more of your kind near her. You intend to put your filthy paws on my daughter. I guess it's time I show you all just what I mean by OR ELSE.

speaker: Daichi
text: We're here to poach fair and square! You won't stop us!

speaker: Selkie
text: That was fun! But now they're all gone. Just when it was getting interesting!

speaker: Kaden
text: Hmm. Selkie, you do realise that they were trying to catch you, right?

speaker: Selkie
text: Yup! It was like tag!

speaker: Kaden
text: Whoa, Daughter. It really wasn't. But I'm just glad you're safe.

speaker: Selkie
text: Hey, hey, Daddy? Are all of your battles like this?

speaker: Kaden
text: Hm? Yeah, pretty much.

speaker: Selkie
text: Yay! I can't wait to see more battles! So I'm coming with you.

speaker: Kaden
text: What? No, you're not.

speaker: Selkie
text: Wheee! Yes, I am! This is going to be way more fun that being stuck at home.

speaker: Kaden
text: Battles aren't fun and games, Selkie. They're sad and deadly.

speaker: Selkie
text: They are? I'm sorry, Daddy. I guess I just got carried away.

speaker: Kaden
text: Nope. No need to apologize. Just as long as you understand.

speaker: Selkie
text: You know, since you and your friends saved me... I need to return the favor. That's the right thing to do, isn't it?

speaker: Kaden
text: Wow, Selkie. You really are growing up, aren't you? Yes, it's good to repay debts.

speaker: Selkie
text: Then it's settled. I can play with your friends from now on!

speaker: Kaden
text: Huh? I didn't say you could come. I guess they would like to play with you though. Not too rough now!

speaker: Selkie
text: I'll do my best, Daddy!

speaker: Subaki
text: Well, this isn't at all how I pictured where your daughter lives. I didn't even know that any part of the Deeprealms looked so...ominous.

speaker: Hayato
text: It wasn't this creepy the last time I visited Rhajat. Something terrible has happened.

speaker: Subaki
text: We'd better investigate then.

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmm. Yes, let's hurry in.

speaker: Hayato
text: What's going on around here?!

speaker: Subaki
text: Faceless, everywhere! They seem to be surrounding that house. Maybe even...coming from it?

speaker: Hayato
text: What? But that's where Rhajat lives. It can mean only one thing... She actually did it.

speaker: Subaki
text: Did what?

speaker: Hayato
text: Hmm. There's something I haven't told you about my daughter. She dabbles in the dark arts—the darker, the better. Last time I came here, Rhajat was amusing herself with summoning spells. But she couldn't get them to work.

speaker: Subaki
text: Hmm, I just can't believe that your daughter could possibly...

speaker: Rhajat
text: Hee hee hee! After all my toil, the Nohrian monstrosities are mine—ALL MINE!

speaker: Hayato
text: Does that convince you?

speaker: Subaki
text: I guess I shouldn't have been surprised. She's got your knack for magic. It seems Rhajat has succeeded beyond her wildest dreams.

speaker: Hayato
text: More like her weirdest nightmares. We have to get in there and clean up this mess!

speaker: Rhajat
text: Come to me, my children! Come to Rhajat, your loving mother!

speaker: Hayato
text: Seriously? That girl...she's dabbled herself into a very dark place.

speaker: Rhajat
text: Hee hee hee! Father, you've arrived! Meet your grandchildren! Aren't you proud of me? I've mastered the art of summoning! The Faceless just keep on coming. It's so beautiful!

speaker: Hayato
text: What? This is horrifying! If you summon any more of them, we won't be able to cut them all down!

speaker: Rhajat
text: Huh? But I've only just begun. They're a part of our family, Father!

speaker: Hayato
text: Listen, you need to stop this. Now! Please, Father knows best.

speaker: Rhajat
text: What? How can you say that? You know NOTHING about summoning!

speaker: Hayato
text: Rhajat, you know that's not what I mean! Now, help us clean up this mess.

speaker: Rhajat
text: Fine, Father.

speaker: Rhajat
text: Hee hee hee! You truly want to tangle with me?!

speaker: Rhajat
text: But...why? I was only furthering my dark education!

speaker: Hayato
text: Well, we've cleaned up THAT mess. Now, Daughter, I've never discouraged you from dabbling in the dark arts... But do you have to pursue the worst possible spells?!

speaker: Rhajat
text: I have been working on a spell that makes a person taller and less baby faced.

speaker: Hayato
text: What? Are you really?

speaker: Rhajat
text: No, of course not!

speaker: Hayato
text: Very funny. Anyway, no more summoning. Understand?!

speaker: Rhajat
text: Huh? No way! My next spell is going to be a hundredfold more effective!

speaker: Hayato
text: Seriously?! What possesses you to do such things? In that case, I've got no choice. You're coming with us.

speaker: Rhajat
text: What? But this is my sanctum!

speaker: Hayato
text: If you're going to keep at these studies, then I've got to keep an eye on you. I fact, I'm going to take charge of your magical education.

speaker: Rhajat
text: I don't have a say in the matter, do I? All right, as long as you give me interesting challenges, Father.

speaker: Hayato
text: How about you start on that spell to make a person taller? That seems respectable!

speaker: Rhajat
text: Hmpf.

speaker: Subaki
text: Pardon the intrusion, but I've got some great ideas for research. How about a spell that makes a person less afraid of the dark? Or a cure for crying every time someone botches his battle moves?

speaker: Rhajat
text: Who would need that—you?!

speaker: Subaki
text: Oh, no, don't be silly. I mean your father here. I think he should focus more on being braver, not taller.

speaker: Hayato
text: Subaki, I'm braver than you are!

speaker: Rhajat
text: Hee hee hee! I'll get to working on those spells right away. After seeing you in action here, Father, I can see how I can really help. I think all your friends need my help too. Oh, this IS going to be fun!

speaker: Rhajat
text: I suppose it's time to take one last look at the inside of my dark sanctum. I won't miss it too much. It's just a home. The real darkness is inside me.

speaker: Faceless
text: Gurrr...

speaker: Rhajat
text: Huh? One of my children lived?

speaker: Facelss
text: GUUURRR!

speaker: Rhajat
text: N-n-no! I'm your mother!

speaker: Corrin
text: Stop, abomination! Get away from her!

speaker: Faceless
text: GUURR...raaahh.

speaker: Corrin
text: That was a close one. Are you all right, Rhajat?

speaker: Rhajat
text: ... *urgh*

speaker: Corrin
text: You are hurt, aren't you?!

speaker: Rhajat
text: You...what's your name?

speaker: Corrin
text: Who, me? I'm Corrin.

speaker: Rhajat
text: You're this Corrin that Father's been talking about?

speaker: Corrin
text: Er, yes?

speaker: Rhajat
text: Thank you for rescuing me, Corrin. I owe you my life. No one's ever been willing to sacrifice themselves for me before. I owe you my life. All of it. every hour, every day until the end.

speaker: Corrin
text: Huh? That's, uh, not necessary.

speaker: Rhajat
text: You've got my full attention. I'll watch you like a hawk on a mouse. Forever and ever—until one of us is no more. And maybe then some. Your name is branded upon my mind's eye, Corrin.

speaker: Corrin
text: What a strange young woman. I guess that's just her way of saying thanks? Of course, she could have just said thanks. Odd one, that Rhajat.

speaker: Rhajat
text: You summoned me, Corrin?

speaker: Corrin
text: Ack!

speaker: Rhajat
text: I'm here for you, should you need me. My dark arts are at your disposal. I will be close as your shadow. Actually...I will BE your shadow.

speaker: Niles
text: Here we are. At the town known for its selection of great tombs. Pardon, I meant tomes.

speaker: Odin
text: Such are the whims of fate. Tombs? Tomes? I walk in darkness either way. But today it's books, not graves, that I've come to find. Books open to knowledge! Books laid on their spines! Books flapping their wings like the greatest of dragons! Climb on, they say! Ride with us to the realm of enlightenment! Oh! Ewwwgh...

speaker: Niles
text: What's wrong? Touch of gas?

speaker: Odin
text: MY ACHING BLOOD! This town...something...someone... The very air in this place threatens the even keel of my interior being. The shadows within are ascending. The dark overtakes me! Ha, it tickles. But now, sinking into my well of darkness, I drown in power. Soon I can tap into the strongest of all my abilities... Eldritch Smackdown!

speaker: Niles
text: Ugh. Sorry I asked. Huh, who's that?

speaker: Ophelia
text: Ah, fair finger of fate, pointing me here to this town. What power I sense brimming in these quaint lanes. Power! No, Ophelia, contain, yourself. You mustn't give in to such a swell. You alone hold day and night at bay. You are the dusk. Be strong. Ewwgh! Such power! If only I drank of it, I could use the strongest of my abilities...

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Odin. She speaks just like you. Kind of the dark—and so on.

speaker: Odin
text: Hmm? Could it be... Ophelia?

speaker: Ophelia
text: Oh, Father. Hi! It's been too long.

speaker: Odin
text: Whoa, whoa. No, no, no. You can't just hi me. Why are you in my world?

speaker: Ophelia
text: Oh, Father. You know me. I'm always questing after the unknown. I've come here searching for a tome. The Super-Ultimate Tome.

speaker: Odin
text: What? The Super-Ultimate—? Uh-oh.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Yes. Clearly you know of it. After all, it was listed in your own Book of Supreme Fatal Divine Names. You know, your encyclopedia of exceedingly dangerous thingamajigs. The Super-Ultimate Tome was the most forbidden book listed there.

speaker: Odin
text: What? But, Daughter, please don't tell me you read from my book of lists. That was private!

speaker: Ophelia
text: Sorry. Couldn't help myself. Now I crave The Super-Ultimate Tome. I won't stop until I have the book. The darkness within me demands it. It bangs on the door of my heart. I will let it through, Father. Just as soon as I have that book.

speaker: Odin
text: Um, just one thing, Ophelia. That book—

speaker: Boy
text: Augh! Run for your lives! Ruffians are pillaging the town!

speaker: Ophelia
text: What? Not on my watch.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Ophelia, here to serve! Townspeople, you have nothing to fear. I consider this holy ground, and I will bring my full vengeance to bear. When all is said and done, I will have saved The Super-Ultimate Tome too!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Huh? How stupid! One girl, saving this town all by herself?

speaker: Odin
text: Ha ha! I am here too.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Grrah! Who are you?

speaker: Odin
text: The chosen hero arrives! And what is he called, this soldier of darkness...? Odin Dark is his name! And he says that if you lay so much as a finger on his daughter... Odin Dark will deliver his most deadly move... Eldritch Smackdown!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Um...what?

speaker: Ophelia
text: The chosen heroine arrives! And what is she called, this maiden of darkness? Ophelia Dusk is her name! I've got this scene covered, Odin Dark. You can exit stage left. For Ophelia Dusk will now deliver her most deadly move... Luminary Uppercut!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Two of you freaks? What is this? A shakedown? Well, you can't scam quality thugs like me and my crew. Everyone, get 'em!

speaker: Child
text: No! Don't say it's true! Bad times come to our little town? I'd try this spell out on them if I was a little older. Here, you take it.

speaker: Boy
text: Uhh! What? Where? Ruffians? Here? We don't stand a chance! But maybe you can do something. Especilly if I give you this!

speaker: Girl
text: Ruffians? Here? Thank you for helping us! I don't have much. But, here.

speaker: Old Man
text: Hmm, all this fighting is over books you want to use as weapons? I bet you'd like me to give you a weapon...to help end this fighting over weapons. Enjoy your vicious cycle.

speaker: Senno
text: I've come for this town's rare tomes. They're mine—ALL MINE!

speaker: Odin
text: Ophelia, I've got bad news for you. That so-called encyclopedia of mine? The Book of Supreme Fatal Divine Names? It's just my idea book. A place to scribble down impressive names for weapons. That's all.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Huh? So The Super-Ultimate Tome...

speaker: Odin
text: Yes. It doesn't exist.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Ugh, really?

speaker: Odin
text: Sorry to disappoint you, Ophelia, But maybe this will make it up to you.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Well, um... It's a tome.

speaker: Odin
text: I bought it here in town—dashed into a store between moves. I have a habit of naming my weapons. But I haven't named this one. Why don't you name it?

speaker: Ophelia
text: I can name this tome myself, Father? Whatever should I call it? Ah! I have the perfect name.

speaker: Odin
text: Hmm? That was a little quick, no? What's the name then?

speaker: Ophelia
text: Ta-dah! I name this tome... Missiletainn!

speaker: Odin
text: Missiletainn?! Why THAT name?

speaker: Ophelia
text: I saw it scribbled in the margins on the very last page of your idea book. Though it had to be more than just an idea for a name, Father. There were comments there that said it was a pretty crummy weapon, as it turned out. What was it? Slips out of the hand? Cuts dull as a butter knife? I don't care. I just loved the sound of that name: Missiletainn.

speaker: Odin
text: What an ear you have—attuned to the slightest intimations of legend. Missiletainn was the ONLY name in that book I ever gave to a real weapon. Oh, yes. How I remember Missiletainn. The blade to which my hand was wed! The blade from which my enemies fled! We were quite a pair.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Father, is your hand empty now? Let us hold hands, father and daughter, and let our foes flee our wrath. After all, now I hold Missiletainn. So we are three.

speaker: Odin
text: What?! If I sift through your flair for words...

speaker: Ophelia
text: Yes! I want to travel with you. We are both chosen ones.

speaker: Odin
text: Ha ha! Then we march together. We are the chosen...two! I can only hope the others won't be too humbled around so much excellence. Go introduce yourself, Ophelia.

speaker: Ophelia
text: At once, Father! Just imagine... Ophelia Dusk and Odin Dark, together at last!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey! Did you catch all that? Dusk and dark... Think the rest of us are at risk of being upstaged?

speaker: Silas
text: No way! They'll never— Wait. What do you mean, upstage us? Well, anyway. It's all harmless fun. And Ophelia seems pretty nice.

speaker: Odin
text: So excited, Daughter! I can't believe that we've been united. Both of us, on the eternal stage of battle! With Missiletainn in a supporting part! I can already see it... A thousand foes before us, falling before my might.

speaker: Ophelia
text: Leave some for me! At least one hundred. No, FIVE HUNDRED.

speaker: Odin
text: I laugh at the odds. Let our foes come. I will smack them down!

speaker: Ophelia
text: I'll laugh louder and smack them harder! I will show you how it's done, Father!

speaker: Sophie
text: Good job, Avel...trotting gently...nice and steady...sweet as can be... Wow! We're doing so well today. Not at all like yester—WHOA! Easy there, Avel! I said, EASY! AAAAAAVEL!

speaker: Sophie
text: Urgh. Threw me off again. Daddy said Avel would be the ideal horse for me. But just look at him! Bucking me off! Galloping away! He's nuts! And now where's he going?! Oh no. OH NO! What?! AVEL! GET BACK HERE! That darn horse is heading for the portal to Daddy's world! I'M COMING, AVEL! I'LL GET YA, BUDDY!

speaker: Sophie
text: Whoa! So THIS is Daddy's world? Hmm, not SO different, I guess. There you are, Avel. Why'd you run off like that? We can't leave our Deeprealm! Easy there... Let me up...phew! Now let's ride back before anyone finds out, or else I'll get the scolding of my life! Besides, Daddy said that it's super-dupity dangerous in his world.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Hey, you! Chump! You're not getting away without paying a toll. And by toll, I mean all your money. Hand it over. Or I'll take your hands!

speaker: Boy
text: Someone, help!

speaker: Nichol
text: Heh. Sing like that again, and I might just let my comrade pluck out your tongue. Then again, my band of malevolent brothers is in dire need of amusement. So carry on. Scream your heart out. Top of your lungs now...

speaker: Sophie
text: Eeep! That stuff over there is just about as super-double-dupity dangerous as it gets! I don't care if I will get in trouble from Daddy—I have to come to the rescue! I bet Daddy will even be proud of me! Steady there, Avel. We're gonna head straight for 'em. CHARGE! Wh-wh-what?! Avel, no! You're going the wrong— WAAAAAAY!

speaker: Silas
text: Finally, we're here. There's the village under attack. But we're so late! Looks like those marauders have already torn apart this place. Oh, no. A band of villagers is rushing the enemies. A sure massacre! We must save whomever we can and bring these villains to justice.

speaker: Silas
text: Sophie...is that you?!

speaker: Sophie
text: Daddy! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Silas
text: I'd ask the same of you, Sophie. Why did you leave your Deeprealm?

speaker: Silas
text: Sophie, you're mumbling.

speaker: Sophie
text: No, Daddy! That is, Daddy, I'm here because...because... Because I heard the shouts of villagers coming through the portal! So I, er... I leapt astride Avel, snapped the reins, and we rode to the rescue!

speaker: Silas
text: Sophie, you've made me proud. I didn’t know you had this in you! It's high time we ride into battle together. Father and daughter—true cavaliers!

speaker: Sophie
text: Uh, wha—? I mean, yes, Daddy! I'll do my best. So will Avel! Now let's save those villagers!

speaker: Nichol
text: What hope do any of you pathetic fools have against me? But you, friend, have an especially hopeful light in your eyes. Come closer. I'll be glad to extinguish it for you.

speaker: Sophie
text: Good job, Avel! You obeyed my every direction in that battle! But why here? And not at—?

speaker: Silas
text: So, Sophie...your steed is more unruly than you've led me to believe. I'm not surprised that he behaved here. The difference wasn't him. It was you. You displayed newfound confidence. Your directions were assured! That's the secret to being a good cavalier: living up to your horse's expectations.

speaker: Sophie
text: Ugh. That's all I needed to do this whole time?

speaker: Silas
text: Yes, but it's no easy feat, especially since I gave you Avel to ride. When you told me long ago that you wanted to ride a horse like me... I knew I had to get you a horse with the highest expectations. Avel would help you grow into a commanding figure. You see, Sophie, this is really about more than your steed. If you can ride Avel, you'll command the respect of everyone you meet. Many who live through these times of war are ready to give up. I need my daughter to inspire everyone to pick themselves off the ground.

speaker: Sophie
text: That's why you gave me Avel? I guess I see, Daddy. But I'm not that Sophie yet. I'm still only...me.

speaker: Silas
text: Only? Hmm. There's nothing only about you, Sophie. Look at what you did today! Think about everything you're about to do!

speaker: Sophie
text: Huh? What do you mean?

speaker: Silas
text: You're leaving the Deeprealms. You're going to travel with our group! Honestly, I'd feel safer with you staying where you are. But you're ready for this. I think you'll learn to handle Avel even faster that way. I'll teach you what I know. That is, only if you want to.

speaker: Sophie
text: I could learn a lot from you, Daddy! Of course I want to come!

speaker: Silas
text: I have faith in you. You might surpass me. You're already better than you know!

speaker: Sophie
text: Thanks, Daddy! Wow, Avel. You and I are finally— Whoa, there! WHOA! THIS way! Not THAT way! We're not going back to the Deeprealms! Avel, SIT! Avel, STAY!

speaker: Silas
text: Well, I see I've got my work cut out for me. Now that we'll be riding together, she'll see how her daddy handles his horse.

speaker: Sophie
text: Great! I got Avel back under control!

speaker: Silas
text: Sophie, well done. You see? The secret is taking control. The most important thing is to always be firm, and yet—WHOA! Does he always do that?! Bite at your face?! Th-that's all right. I knew he'd be a handful. It's just a matter of—

speaker: Sophie
text: Avel! Stop eating my hair! It took me forever to grow it back the last time!

speaker: Silas
text: Huh. That's uh...not good. Avel! Bring her back! AVEL!

speaker: Faceless
text: Grrahhh...

speaker: Old Woman
text: Run, Mozu! Please, dear! Run and don't look back!

speaker: Mozu
text: Mother, no! Take my hand! We'll run together!

speaker: Faceless
text: GRRAH... HRRGLL!

speaker: Old Woman
text: Aaarghhh!

speaker: Mozu
text: NO! MOTHER!

speaker: Corrin
text: Did you hear that?! Those screams! Something terrible is happening!

speaker: Felicia/Jakob
text: We've got trouble, all right! This village is under attack by the Faceless. But this place has been ravaged. We're too late!

speaker: Corrin
text: No! There must be some survivors. With any luck, some people escaped, but if there's even one left here somewhere... Let's get searching everyone!

speaker: Mozu
text: M-M-Mother... My village... They're all dead... I'm alone. Nowhere to go! And those monsters... They're coming back for me...

speaker: Corrin
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Mozu
text: Waugh! No! My mother... My friends...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm here to help. Where are they?

speaker: Mozu
text: My mother wouldn't take my hand. She's... she's...

speaker: Corrin
text: I'm so sorry. But there's no time to grieve. Not now. Stay behind me. I'll keep you safe.

speaker: Mozu
text: No! I have to fight! For Mother! For all my friends! For everything those monsters took from me!

speaker: Corrin
text: All right. We've finished off the last of the Faceless.

speaker: Mozu
text: ... Um, but what do I do? They took my Mother... My life.

speaker: Corrin
text: You must have some family near here. We'll be glad to take you there.

speaker: Mozu
text: There's no one. I couldn't even start over here by myself. All the homes, fields... It's all destroyed. But I wouldn't want to stay here even if it wasn't. Everyone I called family is dead. Every house... a grave.

speaker: Corrin
text: Listen, we'll take you in. We can't replace all those you've lost. But we'll take care of you.

speaker: Mozu
text: I can join your group?

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, but only until we find you a safe place to call home. Our group... a family of sorts... is bound by a dangerous cause. We go from one battle to the next, ever in peril. That's no life for you.

speaker: Mozu
text: I'm not afraid. I can help. I might even save you or your friends. Let me join your cause, whatever it is. I'll keep your family safe.

speaker: Corrin
text: Yes, of course. I have to admit, you sound just like one of us already.

speaker: Mozu
text: I'll do my best. And I'll stay safe. After all, Mother's watching over me now.

speaker: Azura
text: Ah, how I love to sail upon the ocean! To be free from the confines of land! The roar of the waves is like the sweetest lullaby.

speaker: Felicia
text: We've got trouble, Lady Azura!

speaker: Azura
text: Slow down, Felicia. Tell me what's happened.

speaker: Felicia
text: Um...um...a pegasus—I mean, the young man riding it— He's just crashed onto our ship! Well, the pegasus did too, but—

speaker: Azura
text: What was that?! Someone on a pegasus has just landed? Point the way!

speaker: Jakob
text: We have trouble, Azura!

speaker: Azura
text: How can that be, Jakob? We're so far upon the ocean!

speaker: Jakob
text: I've just receive news that a young man riding a pegasus has landed upon our ship. At breakneck speed, too. He and his steed may have sustained serious injuries.

speaker: Azura
text: What was that?! A pegasus rider? Please, point the way!

speaker: Azura
text: Shigure, my son! What has brought you out here?

speaker: Shigure
text: M...Mother...? Did I make it? I...I flew out of the Deeprealms to find you!

speaker: Azura
text: Oh, my! You're hurt! And your pegasus looks ready to collapse!

speaker: Shigure
text: Never mind us. We need to return to my Deeprealm at once. My village is under attack. You and your friends must help me save whoever's left.

speaker: Azura
text: What's that? Your village—? But from what enemy?

speaker: Shigure
text: I...I don't know. It's hard to see them sometimes.

speaker: Azura
text: What?

speaker: Shigure
text: They're only semivisible. But they're fierce fighters. One thing I am sure is that they're after ME. My friends risked their lives helping me get away. I...I think they're all...

speaker: Azura
text: Shigure, you don't know that. Wait, I sense something...someone...

speaker: Shigure
text: It's them!

speaker: Azura
text: My apologies, Shigure. This grim turn of events is all my fault. They're after you...because of me.

speaker: Shigure
text: Come again? What do you have to do with this, Mother?

speaker: Azura
text: Well, I can't explain. Not here. Now, a moment, please.

speaker: Azura
text: Shigure, stay close! I'm certain those fiends are readying an attack. But if they think they're getting their hands on you...

speaker: Shigure
text: Mother, who are they? Why did you say this is all your fault?

speaker: Azura
text: I'm sorry to say it must remain a mystery, at least for a little longer.

speaker: Shigure
text: Tell that to my friends.

speaker: Azura
text: Trust me, Son. I had little choice. Now, hide yourself. I'll take care of them. That's the least I can do.

speaker: Shigure
text: It's just...it's just not right. My whole village, and because of what? You must have your reasons for keeping such deadly secrets, Mother. But this fight is now MINE too. I must avenge my friends.

speaker: Azura
text: ... Listen, Shigure. The stakes are higher than you can imagine. But if you insist in fighting, then promise that you'll do so at a safe distance.

speaker: Shigure
text: No. My friends didn't have any such choice. I won't shy from battle.

speaker: Azura
text: I see. Then I promise that MY friends will keep you safe as can be. Losing you would ruin me. You will live, my son, even if it's at the cost of my life.

speaker: Shigure
text: No, Mother!

speaker: Azura
text: We won't lose. Not if I can help it. My friends and I will make them pay. Everyone, prepare for battle!

speaker: Shigure
text: I’m with you all the way, Mother.

speaker: Azura
text: We've been broadsided! Stay on guard everyone!

speaker: Azura
text: Shigure, the battle is won, but your worst fears have proven true. I slipped away to your Deeprealm for a moment. These invaders... They razed your village. There is no one left. Everyone who took care of you in my stead, all of them are—

speaker: Shigure
text: EVERYONE? Ohhhh... No, no, no... NOOOO!

speaker: Azura
text: ... I'm sorry. If we'd come sooner... That is, if only I'd warned you about them...

speaker: Shigure
text: No. You and your friends have clearly known these evils and more. I'm at fault for being a child too long. My eyes have been closed. But my heart has been opened. I can imagine, a little, what it must feel like to live in your world. Still you find it in yourself to sing. And so must I.

speaker: Azura
text: Sing? What are you going to sing?

speaker: Shigure
text: You know the song well, Mother. ♪

speaker: Azura
text: Truly, how well I do. You plan to sing it as a requiem for your dead? How beautiful. Even beyond the clouds, your friends will be moved to tears. Surely, a melancholy rain will fall upon your village.

speaker: Shigure
text: Mother! But what am I to do now? Everyone I knew, except you—

speaker: Azura
text: Ah, I have no choice but to find another place to hide you.

speaker: Shigure
text: I...I don't want to hide anymore. I'm joining your cause.

speaker: Azura
text: What's that? Son, you must stay safe!

speaker: Shigure
text: No. My friends lost their lives trying to save me. I need to learn to protect myself. I need to get strong enough, so I can make the same sacrifice for others.

speaker: Azura
text: ... Very well, Shigure. But you must let me protect you when I can. You cannot deny your mother that.

speaker: Shigure
text: My heart is singing. And it's a song of hope for the future.

speaker: Azura
text: Let us make it a duet, Son.

speaker: Shigure
text: Yes, Mother. It will be my honor.

speaker: Percy
text: Here, Ace! Come to Percy. Come one, come to Percy. Good dragon. You're my only real friend. 'Specially since Pop never visits...

speaker: Percy
text: Uh? What, Ace? Trying to make me feel better?

speaker: Percy
text: Golly, thanks a bunch, Ace! You always know just what to roar! You're the best buddy ever. With you as my sidekick, nothing's gonna get me down! I'm done obeying Pop's dumb rules. Which includes staying here in my Deeprealm. Let's get outta here, Ace!

speaker: Arthur
text: He must be around here somewhere. PERCY? HELLO? PERCY? Oh, my son! My offspring! Oh, sidekick, not yet old enough to kick at my side! Why would you leave our most secret of lairs in your Deeprealm? Ew, oogie. Dragon dung, whizzing past my heroic brow? A close call. But where'd it come from?

speaker: Arthur
text: Percy! Where have you been? I've been worried sick. Leaving the secret lair? Clearly, you must have gotten lost. No need to worry. I'll have you back home in a flash. Must say it's nice to see you, Son. It's been a while. I hardly recognize you.

speaker: Arthur
text: Hmm? What's eating you, Percy? Come on, out with it.

speaker: Percy
text: I hate you, Pops.

speaker: Arthur
text: Huh?!

speaker: Percy
text: All your talk about justice... How just is it to never visit me? You're...you're... You're a villain! You're my worst enemy! You're my... You're my archnemesis! W-w-waaaaah!

speaker: Arthur
text: Never fear, Percy. Pops is here!  Ahoy there, friend!

speaker: Mercenary
text: Ha. Friend? I'm no friend to some jerk who makes kids cry their eyes out.

speaker: Arthur
text: Ha Ha! You've fallen into the covered pit of misconception, stranger. Here, I'll help you out before you're gored upon the spikes of wrongheadedness! That was no kid. That was my son. My spawn! Fruit of my loins!

speaker: Mercenary
text: What?! The way he ran off crying? No way. Who are you really villain?!

speaker: Arthur
text: Evil has met its match! I am Arthur!

speaker: Mercenary
text: Whuh? No you're not! I recognize you! You're...you're...GAZAK!

speaker: Arthur
text: No. Your ears must be clogged, friend. Listen up. As I just said... Evil has met its match! I am Arthur!

speaker: Mercenary
text: What?! You can't fool me, Gazak! I'd recognize that chin anywhere! It's got bandit written all over it!

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, um, well... I assure you that my chin is not the graffiti wall of evil. Here, fellow, my son comes back. He'll clear this matter up.

speaker: Percy
text: Back, evildoer! Return to whatever dark hole of naughtiness you crawled out of! I think that mercenary has you pegged. You ARE Gazak!

speaker: Arthur
text: Percy!

speaker: Mercenary
text: Charge, friends! I've found Gazak! Time for this bandit to come to justice!

speaker: Arthur
text: What? You must be joking.

speaker: Silas
text: Wow, that really spiraled out of control. We'd better get in there and back Arthur up, I guess.

speaker: Mercenary
text: What?! You tapped into a Dragon Vein! That means you're...royalty. You're no ruffian! And that makes you ALL— Oh, I'm sorry! Please, spare my life! Here, do you want money? Take this—it's all yours. I bet more troops would do the same, if only they realized...

speaker: Percy
text: It's time to deliver some real justice!

speaker: Percy
text: Let's take 'em out, Ace. All of 'em! Pop's next to go!

speaker: Arthur
text: Listen up, Son! Your spree of mayhem is over!

speaker: Percy
text: Justice never loses! And I am on its side! Not you, Pop!

speaker: Arthur
text: Percy, if you insist on this, you leave me no choice but to fight back!

speaker: Percy
text: *sniffle sniffle*

speaker: Arthur
text: I'm sorry, Percy. I never meant to abandon you. I just thought you were absolutely safe, so my job was done until you were older. I screwed up on a heroic scale. Please, forgive me. From this day forward, I'd love for you to join me as a sidekick. Or maybe I'll be yours. Whatever—just as long as we're a justice-slinging duo!

speaker: Percy
text: Uh...really, Pop? Does that mean that you'll come live in my Deeprealm with me?

speaker: Arthur
text: No, the opposite! You're never going back there.

speaker: Percy
text: Pop, do you really mean it? I can stay here with you?

speaker: Arthur
text: It's true! Right here! With me!

speaker: Percy
text: W-w-waaah... W-w-waaaaaaaaah!

speaker: Arthur
text: What is it? Did I blunder again?

speaker: Percy
text: No, I'm just so happy! I didn't want you as my archnemesis, Pop. I really didn't. THIS is what I always wanted.

speaker: Arthur
text: Ha ha! Father-son bond repaired on the nick of time!

speaker: Arthur
text: Hmm? Your dragon? What's got him so darn upset? Whoa! Hold on, big boy. Those are your fangs you're bearing over there.

speaker: Percy
text: Ace, stop! Don't snap at Pops. He didn't do anything bad.

speaker: Arthur
text: Percy! Your trusty steed is looking at me like I'm a meat platter!

speaker: Percy
text: Ace! I'm not sad! Happy! You hear me? HA-PPY! We're staying here with Pops. We don't have to live in our Deeprealm!

speaker: Percy
text: Phew! He's backing off. Good boy! Good boy!

speaker: Arthur
text: Whoa there! I thought you'd be flossing me out of his teeth soon. Glad we cleared all this up. You and your dragon are most welcome with us!

speaker: Percy
text: Golly! Thanks a bunch! I can't wait to learn how to be a better hero from you!

speaker: Arthur
text: Percy, I'm just glad to have you at my side. Now, ready to sock evil in the face? The ol' one-two? Father-son justice?

speaker: Percy
text: Ha ha! YEAH!

speaker: Silas
text: Phew! Good thing that all worked out. Hopefully that'll be the last father-son skirmish we ever see in our party...

speaker: Subaki
text: All right, we're just a stone's throw from the Deeprealm. You must be looking forward to seeing your son again, Saizo.

speaker: Subaki
text: Hmm. I'd swear you look even surlier than usual, Saizo. What's wrong?

speaker: Saizo
text: Ah, just concerned about whether my son is getting the training he needs. He's sixth in a line of Saizos. The firstborn men in our family always take the name. And with the name Saizo comes great expectations. If his training has failed him, my son will be a subpar Saizo. I can't have that. He's much older since last I saw him. I have a fairly severe test in mind. Hmm? People. Ahead.

speaker: Funke
text: What? You refuse your mission? That reeks of treachery. Reconsider, child.

speaker: Asugi
text: Not happening. You could double my cut, and I'd still refuse. I'm out.

speaker: Saizo
text: What in all the bitter hells are you doing here, Son?!

speaker: Asugi
text: And now you too?! If this ain't the brown sprinkles on my sundae...

speaker: Funke
text: What?! You know this boorish blackguard, Asugi?

speaker: Asugi
text: Yup. Sorta.

speaker: Saizo
text: Did he just call you Asugi? What's the meaning of this, Saizo? You have the proud honor of taking MY name, as I took that of my father! You were born a Saizo. You will die a Saizo. That is our family's custom. Besides, who is this fool?

speaker: Asugi
text: Huh? As always, you don't know your head from a hole in the ground. Get lost.

speaker: Funke
text: No, no, no, Asugi, Don't be so rude. He and his friends are our guests! Uninvited, yes. But they can't leave our little party now. They can, in fact, help you fulfill your obligations at this fine affair!

speaker: Saizo
text: Hmm? Obligations? What does he mean by that, Saizo?

speaker: Funke
text: This spoiled guttersnipe wants to abandon our happy family. And right before we're about to break into a manor that will make us fabulously rich. Tsk! Youth, these days.

speaker: Saizo
text: Break into a manor? Are you a thief now? You work for this powdered cretin?

speaker: Asugi
text: Ha! That's my business.

speaker: Saizo
text: I expect more out of you. You shirk your duties as a firstborn Saizo? Sixth in the line?! And you think I won't make that my business?

speaker: Asugi
text: What a crock. Saizo this?! Sixth that?! You can take your name and- Well, you know.

speaker: Saizo
text: WHAT?!

speaker: Asugi
text: I don't take orders. Not from you. Not from anyone. You care about your dumb name more than you've ever cared about me. It's my life. I'll live as I please. See ya.

speaker: Saizo
text: See ya?! No one gets away from me. Not over my dead-

speaker: Funke
text: No, no, no! Now that my Asugi has fled, let's have no more departing bodies. At least, not until I make you pay for driving off my talented associate.

speaker: Saizo
text: What's my damned son gotten us into?!

speaker: Saizo
text: That's it. Last chance, Son! Get back here.

speaker: Asugi
text: Whoops, sorry! Can't hear you! See ya never, old man!

speaker: Saizo
text: Damn that kid. We have to catch up with him before he gets away!

speaker: Funke
text: Ah, one of our guests! Well then, let me extend my invitation to you... An invitation—to die!

speaker: Asugi
text: Stop chasing me!

speaker: Saizo
text: Never. Now tell me, why did you take up with such low creatures?

speaker: Asugi
text: Gotta do something to satisfy my sweet tooth. Besides, you got it all wrong. Or half wrong. Just before you showed up, I told Funke that I didn't want any part of this. When he hired me, he failed to say my job was to sneak in and off the owner. I'll steal anything that's not nailed down. But murder—like that? Nah. Crosses a line. And there's NO price he could pay me to do that. Got my pride, I guess.

speaker: Saizo
text: Do you?

speaker: Asugi
text: What now, genius? You gonna lock me up in my Deeprealm?

speaker: Saizo
text: ... No. You're free to go.

speaker: Asugi
text: What's that again?

speaker: Saizo
text: You heard me. You're no longer the sixth in a proud succession of Saizos... You deserve to be Asugi.

speaker: Asugi
text: Wasn't expecting that... But, wait, is this some sort of trick?

speaker: Saizo
text: No trick. The whole point of being called Saizo is to live up to the honor. You...have a sense of honor. In your own way. So, go.

speaker: Asugi
text: Dad...

speaker: Saizo
text: Oh, Dad now, is it? Good-bye. Enjoy your life.

speaker: Asugi
text: ...Whatever. i wasn't asking for permission. But if it IS my life? I'm coming with you.

speaker: Saizo
text: What? Kid, you make my head hurt.

speaker: Asugi
text: Yeah, I do that. But if I'm off the hook for all this Saizo junk... I think I'd like to tag along with you. Could learn a thing or two. And maybe I can fix that sourpuss face of yours while I'm at it. Ever heard of candy?

speaker: Saizo
text: Candy? Don't tell me that's been a sucker in your mouth this whole time. I thought you were chewing on a blade of grass like some kind of tough guy.

speaker: Asugi
text: Mmm, candy. Yeah, no—I'm all about the sweet stuff. 'Specially if it's on a stick. Suckers. Peppermint sticks. Candy apples. But only if they're really tiny apples. You could say I'm a connoisseur. That's why I steal. Good stuff's expensive. You're gonna love it.

speaker: Saizo
text: No. I don't eat sweets.

speaker: Asugi
text: Ha! Yeah, obviously. And that's why your face is stuck that way.

speaker: Saizo
text: But maybe I'll try just one. I mean, since you worked so hard to pay for it all. Hmm. Asugi, if you manage to not wind up a victim of your own foolishness...You might make me half-proud of you.

speaker: Asugi
text: Huh? Well, if we're getting all touchy-feely here... I'm hoping you're half the Saizo you think you are, Dad. Otherwise I may live to regret this.

speaker: Elise
text: I’m SO excited to meet Forrest! It's weird to think that I have a nephew. And that he’s all grown up! I haven’t seen Forrest since he was barely out of his crib. What’s he like now? He’s a troubadour, right? Think he wants to join us? The more the merrier!

speaker: Leo
text: No. And, er, let’s cancel this trip. We can go to this Deeprealm some other day.

speaker: Elise
text: What? Cancel the trip? But I’ve looked forward to seeing Forrest. And you haven’t visited him in forever. Don’t you miss your son?

speaker: Niles
text: Milord Leo? Urgent news. The town just ahead is being swarmed by brigands. They also say that a beautiful woman was caught in all the fracas. But she’s apparently a troubadour and is doing her best to treat the wounded.

speaker: Leo
text: No, this can’t be...

speaker: Elise
text: Uh-oh, what now? You’re as pale as a ghost.

speaker: Leo
text: We need to get there, before...before... Let’s just get there...fast!
Well, that’s that. I must have healed a dozen villagers. I’d better keep looking for more wounded. Those brigands—mindless beasts!

speaker: Elise
text: Ah! That must be the troubadour we heard about. She’s as beautiful as they say. Don’t you agree, Leo?

speaker: Elise
text: Big Brother? What’s wrong?

speaker: Forrest
text: Father! You’re here!

speaker: Elise
text: Hm? What do you mean...Father? You mistake us for someone else. I mean, unless—HA! Unless my brother here has been hiding a second child!

speaker: Leo
text: Don't be crass, Elise.

speaker: Forrest
text: Father? What does she mean? Has the cat got your tongue? Hmm. I'll introduce myself then. Delighted to make your acquaintance, Aunt Elise. I'm Forrest.

speaker: Elise
text: What?! You're Leo's son?

speaker: Forrest
text: Of course. The one and only.

speaker: Elise
text: Oh, wow! You're...you're... You're better than I could have ever imagined! And your sense of style is...is... It's exquisite!

speaker: Forrest
text: Why, thank you.

speaker: Leo
text: You... What are YOU doing outside of the Deeprealms?

speaker: Forrest
text: I heard that this village is a fine place to shop for sewing supplies. My village has an abominable selection. One cannot make fashion from burlap. But soon as I arrived, brigands came crawling out of the woodwork. Fortunately for the villagers here, I came just in time to heal their wounded.

speaker: Leo
text: You’re a disgrace.

speaker: Forrest
text: Oh? Excuse me? Since when is saving lives considered a disgrace?

speaker: Leo
text: You know what I mean, Forrest. You! The way you dress. I’ve told you before...

speaker: Forrest
text: But... never so cruelly! Why are you being so hateful? In front of Aunt Elise too!

speaker: Elise
text: Leo! What’s wrong with you?! Embrace our lovely Forrest!

speaker: Leo
text: No—and hold your tongue, Elise. This isn’t your business.

speaker: Forrest
text: I’m sorry... Sorry that I ever left my Deeprealm! I’ll go back where I’m appreciated.

speaker: Leo
text: Well then, godspeed. But...hold on, Forrest! Watch where you’re—! You’re running straight for—!

speaker: Forrest
text: No! Get your paws off of me!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Well hello, young miss! What’s a lady like you doing in this pigsty? Heh. How about I be a gentleman and put you somewhere nice and safe. Wouldn’t want a pretty thing like you to get hurt. Let’s get ‘er, boys. She’ll fetch a king’s ransom in gold.

speaker: Forrest
text: And now THIS too?!

speaker: Elise
text: Stop! Forrest—we’re coming!

speaker: Elise
text: Leo! Stop being a jerk and help me save your son!

speaker: Elise
text: All right! Then I guess it’s up to the rest of us to rescue my nephew!

speaker: Leo
text: Hmm... These dastards may intend to keep Forrest safe for ransom. But if hard pressed, such brutal apes wouldn't think twice about killing him. We should try to keep the peace as long as possible—until we get near Forrest.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Nice try! You raise a finger against us? I'll send an axman for our hostage. Besides, some of you look classy enough to make for even BETTER hostages. Har! Get 'em all, boys!

speaker: Gazak
text: I don't care WHO you are! This village is MINE. And everyone in it too!

speaker: Forrest
text: What a shame, Father. To meet your brave friends—and now say farewell? But I’ll make good on my promise to head back to my Deeprealm. Don’t think for one moment that I’m leaving to spare your feelings. You’re unworthy of me, Father. I’ll miss Aunt Elise, of course. But I’m sure that SHE will visit me. And so, farewell.

speaker: Leo
text: Forrest...

speaker: Boy
text: Please, wait! Forrest, is it? You may not remember—you saved me. As I lay dying, there you were! And then I was fine! I don’t have much. But please, take this. Just a small token of my appreciation.

speaker: Forrest
text: Why, thank you! This broach is beautiful. But I can’t take this. I was only doing my duty.

speaker: Boy
text: Uh-huh! Yes you will! My whole family would have been dead without you. Wait right here. I’ll get them, and a lot of other people who want to thank you!

speaker: Leo
text: ... Nice trinket you got there. I mean... Er, I mean... Sorry, I can be a bit of a jerk, as Elise so bluntly puts it. That is...indeed a lovely keepsake the villager gave you. And you are the hero here. We...I merely blundered in late.

speaker: Forrest
text: Oh? Well, Father, I know it must agonize you to say something nice to me. I’ll take your words with me as a keepsake too.

speaker: Leo
text: I’m sorry. I truly am. I must seem like a stone-hearted father to you. You’re right to say I’m not worthy. That Elise was able to see you as a person of sterling qualities... While I couldn’t? I’m, er, I’m a better person than this. So I like to think.

speaker: Forrest
text: Father? An apology from you? Don’t bother. I really don’t need—

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, I’m sure you don’t, Son. You’re far stronger than I ever could be. And I’m embarrassed to ask... But I wonder if you’d want to spend more time with your father? I don’t mean in the Deeprealms. I mean here, with me.

speaker: Forrest
text: ... What a joy! I can get to know my Aunt Elise. She and I will be fast friends. I might even learn a thing or two about fashion from her. Or she from me.

speaker: Elise
text: Yay! You’re actually going to come with us, Forrest?

speaker: Forrest
text: Of course. I couldn’t say no to my Aunt Elise.

speaker: Elise
text: Hm? Hold on. You have to stop that RIGHT now, Forrest. I’m not going anywhere with you if you keep on with this “Aunt” stuff.

speaker: Forrest
text: Fair enough...Elise.

speaker: Elise
text: Phew! I’m just NOT ready to grow up THAT much yet.

speaker: Forrest
text: Well, you’re sure about this? I’m giving up a lot to join you, Father.

speaker: Leo
text: Yes, absolutely. And I give you my solemn vow, Forrest... I’ll learn to be a father worthy of you.

speaker: Old Man
text: Hmm, yes. You will do nicely. If you are willing to help. A band of thieves has been prowling around my manor lately. They've heard that I'm storing some precious Nohrian objects here. I consider myself quite a collector of cultural items. So you must understand... I'm losing sleep, worrying about those thieves breaking in to steal them. I doubt this matters much to great heroes like you. But to preserve Nohr's culture... Would you help?

speaker: Silas
text: Absolutely. For Nohr, anything! And we happen to have our best expert on thievery right here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh! Who, little ol' me? Sure, I know a thing or two about manors and how to crack'em. I know how I'd break in. So I'm already 10 steps ahead of them.

speaker: Old Man
text: Ah, then I place my trust in you. Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: The pleasure is mine. Believe me. When I catch petty crooks in the act, they never fail to soil their breeches. It's always good fun to see fools brought low.

speaker: Niles
text: All right. We're ready, Silas. Those fools won't even know what hit 'em. They're outside in the shadows. And they'll be inside soon. Off with you. Or else you'll scare these jokers away.

speaker: Silas
text: I have faith in you, Niles. Now, be careful.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sweet faith! Best I not rely on that. I'm better under cover of darkness. Now, when will they... Ah! That didn't take long.
Ooof!

speaker: Niles
text: You can't hide from me. Come out, come out, whoever you are. You call yourself a thief, blundering in here like that? You're a disgrace to your profession. Come on, show your face!

speaker: Niles
text: Nina?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Nina
text: Huh? Father?!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, you should be in your Deeprealm. Where I put you.

speaker: Nina
text: Hmpf! You didn’t even notice that I broke out of there a ways back! I had to pursue my true calling. That of chivalrous thievery!

speaker: Niles
text: Huh? Chivalrous thievery?

speaker: Nina
text: That's right. Must I explain it to you? I steal from the rich. I give to the poor. The creep who owns this manor is one of the richest. So here I am. You wouldn’t believe how he's gotten his hoard of treasures. Not that you'd care.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait! None of that matters. What's the one thing I've told you, again and again?! No stealing. And all of your jabber about rich and poor doesn't matter!

speaker: Nina
text: You're wrong. It's justified. Not that I have to justify myself to you. Now, let me go...Father.

speaker: Niles
text: No. I'm here to round up a bunch of filthy thieves, Daughter.

speaker: Nina
text: Hmm. Fine words from one of the filthiest of them.

speaker: Niles
text: How dare you, Nina. Now, come with me.

speaker: Nina
text: Back off! I'm not going anywhere with you. I'm on the side of right. Out of my way!

speaker: Niles
text: You strike your father?! Apologize, now. That might make things right between us. Though I'm still going to make sure you're punished.

speaker: Nina
text: You can't make me! And you can't CATCH me!

speaker: Nina
text: Lookee what we have here... Rooms just full of goods to liberate! My friends! Burgle quickly! They're onto us—just grab and go!

speaker: Niles
text: Nina, stop. You've deluded yourself that you're on the side of right.

speaker: Nina
text: I've dreamed about this, Father. Draining the coffers of the wealthy! Vindicating the poor! We're getting what we need, and then getting out. I leave you to your disgrace. What DO you do these days anyway?! Pfft! Don't answer. I don't care. Good-bye, Father.

speaker: Nina
text: Let me go! Let me go!

speaker: Niles
text: Nina, it's over. Now you're going to get what's coming to you.

speaker: Nina
text: We have wildly differing view on justice. Do your worst, villain.

speaker: Niles
text: Huh? I'm not half the villain you think I am. Why, not even a tenth.

speaker: Nina
text: I spit on your idea of villainy then. And you think you know me? You rarely visited. I made myself into who I am. You shouldn't be surprised that we're different as night and day. So take out your weapon. Do what you must, villain.

speaker: Niles
text: Stop saying that.

speaker: Nina
text: Arghh! Just do it already!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait! This foolishness must end. Come with me, Daughter.

speaker: Nina
text: No! Never.

speaker: Niles
text: Listen—how can you just throw your life away? How can you say that I never had a care for you? Why do you think I hid you in the Deeprealms?

speaker: Nina
text: Because I wasn't worth your time!

speaker: Niles
text: No. I would have kept you near as my dearest treasure. I didn't want you to get caught up in the fighting of our time. I wanted you to be safe. My world does terrible things to people. I have endured it all. But if something happened to you, it would have been the end of me.

speaker: Niles
text: I haven't convinced you, clearly. I'll let you go free. But only as a member of our party. I wish you hadn't chosen a thief's life, but I can keep you from the worst of it.

speaker: Nina
text: You want me to join you? I won't abandon my cause. You're clueless about what I'm doing. The man who owns this manor... Do you KNOW how he got all his money? He's destroyed families. He's swindled women and men of their life savings. One of the people in my group grew up in one such family. We demand justice! And that leaves you and me only one way out of this.

speaker: Niles
text: Nina, please...

speaker: Nina
text: Father, I'll admit that I may have misjudged you—a little. I consider myself a fair woman, so I'll give you one last chance. If you and your friends look into this vile man's dealings... I'll join your party.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, many people misjudge me. But I've done the same to you. I promise to do better, starting now. We'll do what we can here.

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry this all got so damned complicated. Leave it to me to turn a standard manor mission into a family crisis.

speaker: Silas
text: No, don't worry. Besides, thanks to Nina, we exposed what was going on. She was right as can be about the evil schemes this man was up to. We should be thanking your daughter. I know Corrin feels the same.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, really? What a relief. I hate airing my dirty laundry in public.

speaker: Nina
text: ... Oh, what are THEY muttering about? Awfully chummy, those two. The fellow my father is talking to...not bad...not bad... I guess there IS a silver lining in being stuck in my father's brigade. Are there more fine gents worthy of my attention? Maybe a whole smorgasbord of masculine delights?

speaker: Niles
text: Huh? Daughter? What is it? Silas believes that you're staring. Do you need something?

speaker: Nina
text: Nope. Nothing. I'm just fine. You two just carry on.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, fine. We, uh, will.

speaker: Nina
text: Wellity, wellity, wellity... Silas is quite the appetizer. I hope there are more tasty sights in store!

speaker: Hinata
text: Hisame! Over here! It's Dad! Lucky kid I got, living here in a Deeprealm. Catch a whiff of that breeze! Smells like freedom! And good times! HEY! HISAME! OVER HERE!

speaker: Hisame
text: Father, you don't need to yell.

speaker: Hinata
text: What?! Hey, what's with this Father stuff? I was Dad last time I checked. Remember? The guy you'd come running to see when I showed up? What's this? You're way over...there. Do I stink or something?

speaker: Hisame
text: No. I'm just older now.

speaker: Hinata
text: Hmm. My boy's in his teens now? I get it. You don't want to hang out with Dad. I remember being your age. Seems like yesterday. You're just as moody as I was.

speaker: Hisame
text: Leave me alone, Father. You don't understand. I'm not being...moody.

speaker: Hinata
text: Heh. Didn't mean to make fun of you. Just giving you a hard time. C'mon. I came all this way. Can't I ruffle my boy's hair, like the old days?

speaker: Hisame
text: *mumble* ...it.

speaker: Hinata
text: Come again? A little louder? Pipe up? What'd you say?

speaker: Hisame
text: Please stop it, Father! You haven't been back to visit me in ages! You can't just breeze in and out like we're still the best of friends!

speaker: Hinata
text: But I came to visit only a few...? Er, what was it? Days? Weeks?

speaker: Hisame
text: I just... I just want you to leave. You forget how time passes here. I've learned to be just fine on my own. So, good-bye, Father.

speaker: Hinata
text: ... Aw, man. I really screwed this up. Last time he was so happy. But, now? There goes my little boy, off and running... Whoa. Wait. Where IS he running?! Uh-oh.

speaker: Hisame
text: Oh, dear. I didn't mean to do that. I've run into Father's world.

speaker: Faceless
text: Gurr-graaah...

speaker: Hisame
text: Ayaaaah! This is where Father lives? Around m-m-monsters like this?! If only he were here! No. I have to fight my own battles. Starting now.

speaker: Hinata
text: Are you hurt, Hisame?

speaker: Hisame
text: Father, you came to rescue me? After everything I said?

speaker: Hinata
text: Hey now, don't you worry. Your dad's here. Late, yeah. But here. And these monsters don't stand a chance against me!

speaker: Hisame
text: Hmm. *mumble*...a hero.

speaker: Hinata
text: What? You say something? Can't mumble in battle. You gotta get to it!

speaker: Hisame
text: No, it's nothing. Really.

speaker: Hinata
text: Ah, well, if you say so. Now, excuse your dad while he goes in swinging! Hide over there, Son. I'll give a shout when it's safe to come out!

speaker: Hisame
text: No... I'm staying. I've got your back, Father.

speaker: Hinata
text: Whoa! When'd you grow up to be a hero like your ol' dad? I've got your back too, Son. No one's ever going to get between us.

speaker: Hisame
text: Yes, I'll make sure of that.

speaker: Hinata
text: All right, come on. Let's show these gross piles of evil who's boss.

speaker: Hisame
text: Let's end this quickly. It's cutting into my father-son time.

speaker: Hisame
text: Thank you, Father—to you and your friends. I don't know what I would have done. And with that, good-bye.

speaker: Hinata
text: Hey now, you're still giving up on me? That's it? No talking it through?

speaker: Hisame
text: I...I can explain... Of course I clearly belong in the Deeprealms. That's why you stuck me there, right? Because I couldn't make it here?

speaker: Hinata
text: You've got it all wrong. Come on. Hold up. Let's talk this ALL out.

speaker: Hisame
text: Absolutely not. There's no point. You're a hero. I'm not.

speaker: Hinata
text: Hmm. You're being a blockhead, Son. So I'm going to lay it out for you... Did you SEE yourself out there?! That was a HERO on the field! How'd you even do any of that? You were amazing. That's proof enough that you're right. I wasn't here. YOU trained you.

speaker: Hinata
text: Hisame, please. Travel with me? You don't need to go back.

speaker: Hisame
text: Hmm? Go with you? I won't get in your way?

speaker: Hinata
text: No, of course not. I'd love to have you around all the time. I hope I can make it up to you for not visiting enough. Guess your dad's just sort of a jerk, not realizing about the time difference. But I swear we'll spend every possible minute together from now on!

speaker: Hisame
text: Father... I mean, Dad... All right. Let's go. Heh. You haven't changed a bit. Just like when you used to show up and I'd come running...

speaker: Hinata
text: Haha! Yeah! Where's my hug?! I got some hair-ruffling to catch up on! Come on over here!

speaker: Hisame
text: Gods, no. I'm not a child anymore!

speaker: Hinata
text: Oh, that's right. OK, OK... I got it. We're good.

speaker: Hisame
text: You really haven't changed, Dad. Still just a big, dumb bear.

speaker: Hinata
text: All right! I can work with that! Huh? Hang on. Hold everything. You're not! You can't be! Have you gotten TALLER than me?!

speaker: Hisame
text: Heh. Maybe? Maybe not. Anyway, I need to head back home to say good-bye. I'll be back shortly.

speaker: Hinata
text: What? No way! Stand next to me! Just for a second! We gotta measure it out!

speaker: Leo
text: Brother, your son lives around here, does he not?

speaker: Xander
text: Hmph, yes. I hope Siegbert is well. It's been too long since my last visit.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Father? Is that you? By the gods, you've returned!

speaker: Xander
text: Siegbert, my son. You've grown since last I saw you.

speaker: Siegbert
text: I just can't believe it—you're actually really and truly here! Sorry, Father. I don't mean to get so carried away. It's just that... I receive missives that update me on all the important things you're doing. Every time I get one, I wish I could hear it all from you. But I know how busy you are.

speaker: Xander
text: I'm sorry, Son. I hope you haven't been too disappointed in me.

speaker: Siegbert
text: No... I mean, NO! I would never think that of you, Father! Besides, I've been very busy myself. My studies of diplomacy, politesse, etiquette—the arts of conversation... Practicing my swordsmanship, even my penmanship... All of these lessons keep me busy from dawn until dusk—I even dream it! It's in the hopes that you won't be too disappointed in ME.

speaker: Xander
text: I see. How impressive. May I prove worthy of such a diligent son.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Father, please don't say such a...

speaker: Xander
text: Who is this approaching?

speaker: Siegbert
text: They're back!

speaker: Xander
text: What? Who's back?

speaker: Siegbert
text: They return today of all days? At this very moment? Damn them. Don't worry, Father! I'll take care of them immediately!

speaker: Xander
text: Wait, Siegbert!

speaker: Siegbert
text: What's happening? There are never this many of them!

speaker: Xander
text: This invaders seem to be emerging from the waters itself. Curious. Perhaps there's a way to close those doors. So to speak.

speaker: Xander
text: Siegbert, this isn't the first time these enemies have come here, is it? Why didn't you notify me?

speaker: Siegbert
text: I...I just couldn't bring myself to do that, Father.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmm? I expect you to do your duty, Son.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Ah, I'm sorry. But I've heard so many tales of what an important leader you are. You've got a whole realm to look after—countless lives. If I can't manage a few incursions here...if I couldn't defeat them... I wouldn't be worthy of being called your son. So, I couldn't tell you.

speaker: Xander
text: Hmpf. Commendable.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Father? But I've hardly done anything worthy of such praise.

speaker: Xander
text: Siegbert, not many people need to learn how to shoulder such burdens alone. You do, I'm sorry to say. Yet I've never had to tell you so. You came to that realization on your own and meted out justice by yourself. Incredible.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Father, you truly think so? I worried I was bringing shame on your name.

speaker: Xander
text: I'm sorry, Son. While you have grown into your role, I have failed in mine. I am not just a ruler. I am a father, and I have a son to look out for too. From now on, be sure to tell me anything that's on your mind.

speaker: Siegbert
text: ... Um, then may I... Could I possibly... I want to join you, Father!

speaker: Xander
text: What? Join me?

speaker: Siegbert
text: I...I know why you placed me here—to keep me out of the war. But I believe that I will serve our kingdom far better there than here.

speaker: Xander
text: ... Listen, the war is more brutal than you've read in the missives sent to you. Battlefields are bloody. Lives are lost. What you see may haunt you. Are you truly prepared for that? There's no dishonor in saying no. Indeed, I will send you back here if you prove unready.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Yes, I am! I swear that I am!

speaker: Xander
text: I see. I trust you know yourself better than I do, Son. Then you are welcome on our grim march, Siegbert.

speaker: Siegbert
text: Th-thank you, Father. I won't get in your way.

speaker: Xander
text: Together, Son! We march together. Not apart. But I give you my oath: I will defend your life at all costs. That is my privilege as your father. And your right as my son.

speaker: Mercenary
text: We really pulverized those dastards back there, Soleil!

speaker: Soleil
text: Nice work! We chased off those bandits. Did you see 'em run?! Yipe, yipe, yipe! Tails between their legs?! Dirty dogs. And who's the best town watch in this or any other world? Us! That's who!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Wait up. What was that about yipe, yipe, yipe?

speaker: Soleil
text: Hmm? Back for more, eh?

speaker: Ruffian
text: We didn't run. We were just calling some friends to this little party.

speaker: Soleil
text: Uh, what?

speaker: Mercenary
text: Ma'am! There are too many of them. No way we can take them all on!

speaker: Soleil
text: Come on! Turn that frown upside down. Know what you have then? A smile! That's what my father taught me. If you can't smile? Stand on your head! That'll turn your frown upside—

speaker: Ruffian
text: Heh! What a crock. Let's see if you're still smiling once my friends get the best of you. Men, ATTACK!

speaker: Soleil
text: BRING! IT ! ON!

speaker: Laslow
